sentence.Network_cn: 他们现在想要公平竞争。

sentence.Network_en: They decided to put their relationship on a more formal footing.

sentence.Network_cn: 罗伯特失足滑下了河岸。

entry.def: If something is put on a particular footing, it is defined, established, or changed in a particular way, often so that it is able to develop or exist successfully.

example.ex: The new law will put official corruption on the same legal footing as treason.
example.tran: 新法律将规定对公职腐败适用与叛国罪相同的量刑标准。

example.ex: ...research that is aimed at placing training on a more scientific footing.
example.tran: 旨在将培训建立在更加科学的基础上的研究

entry.def: If you are on a particular kind of footing with someone, you have that kind of relationship with them.

example.ex: They decided to put their relationship on a more formal footing...
They are now trying to compete on an equal footing.
example.tran: 他们现在想要公平竞争。

entry.def: If a country or armed force is on a war footing, it is ready to fight a war.

example.ex: The president placed the republic on a war footing.
example.tran: 总统把共和国推到了战争的边缘。

entry.def: You refer to your footing when you are referring to your position and how securely your feet are placed on the ground. For example, if you lose your footing, your feet slip and you fall.

example.ex: He was cautious of his footing, wary of the edge...
example.tran: 他小心翼翼地站在边缘。

example.ex: He lost his footing and slid into the water.

means.word_mean: 1. status with respect to the relations between people or groups;
2. a relation that provides the foundation for something;
3. a place providing support for the foot in standing or climbing

auth_sentence.content: To order the whole establishment on the sparest footing possible.
auth_sentence.res_content: To order the whole establishment on the sparest footing possible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To order the whole establishment on the sparest footing possible.

auth_sentence.content: The important thing here is not to lose your footing.
auth_sentence.res_content: The important thing here is not to lose your footing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The important thing here is not to lose your footing.

auth_sentence.content: The stock market regained its footing as consumer confidence crept back.
auth_sentence.res_content: The stock market regained its footing as consumer confidence crept back.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The stock market regained its footing as consumer confidence crept back.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"状态物品,行业等"; 2. 表介词,"在……情况下……"; 3. 表形容词,"正……的或令人……的"; 4. "……的"

stems_affixes.word_buile: advertise做广告+ing行业→n.广告业;广告活动 adj.广告的;广告业务的
assume假装,假定+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.傲慢的,不逊的,僭越的
change变化+ing正……的或令人……的→正在变化的
correspond通信;符合+ing……的→adj.相应的,通讯的
discriminate辨别,歧视+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有辨别能力的
encourage鼓励+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.鼓舞人心的
endure持久,持续+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.持久的,不朽的
engross吸引+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.引人入胜的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 非常的,极度的,胜过的,过度的

exhilarate使高兴+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.使人兴奋的
fascinate使……入迷+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.迷人的,吸引人的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 谄媚的,讨人欢喜的,奉承的

forego居先+ing……的→adj.在前的,前述的
hard艰难+work工作+ing……的→adj.苦干的,不辞辛劳的
increase增加+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.日益增加的,增大的
inspire鼓舞+ing令人……的→inspiring灌输的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有趣味的,令人好奇[或注意]的
stems_affixes.word_buile: interest使发生兴趣,引起……的注意+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有趣味的,令人好奇[或注意]的

out出+go走+ing正……的或令人……的→走出来→心胸宽→待人友善的
precede先于+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.在前的,前述的
promise允许,答应+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.有希望的,有前途的
refresh使清新+ing令人……的→adj.使心神爽快的
rivet铆钉,固定+ing正……的或令人……的→如铆钉一样把人钉[吸引]住→非常精彩的
threaten恐吓,威胁+ing正……的或令人……的→adj.胁迫的,危险的

sentences.en: She looked over her shoulder to be sure of her footing.
sentences.cn: 她扭头看了看后面以确认自已是否站稳了。

sentences.en: She saw quite well that she was not treated on a footing of equality.
sentences.cn: 她看得很清楚,她并没有受到平等对待。

sentences.en: The army had been placed on a war footing.
sentences.cn: 部队是按战备状态部署的。

sentences.en: The arrangement was put on a permanent footing earlier this year.
sentences.cn: 今年年初就确定了这一安排是长期性的。
